de.esoco.lib.manage

Class MultiLevelCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.manage.MultiLevelCache<K,V>

  • public class MultiLevelCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of a multi-level cache based on Reference implementations. A cache will store key-value pairs up to the capacities that have been set in the constructor. The first level (if not disabled by setting it's capacity to zero) is a permanent cache that holds strong references to it's elements. The second level uses soft references to store it' values and the third level keeps values with weak references. This means that values can be garbage collected by the VM if required. If a discarded reference value is queried from the cache the method get(Object) will return NULL.

    If a new value is added through the method put(Object, Object) and the capacity of the first level is exceeded the least recently accessed entry in the cache will be removed from the first cache level and stored in the second level up to it's designated capacity. If the second level's capacity is reached it's least recently used element will be moved to the third level accordingly.

    The cache access methods are synchronized to allow access from different threads.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiLevelCache

        public MultiLevelCache(int nFirstLevelCapacity,
                       int nSecondLevelCapacity,
                       int nThirdLevelCapacity)
        Creates a new cache with certain capacities.
        Parameters:
        nFirstLevelCapacity - The maximum number of entries that will be kept permanently in this cache (zero to disable the permanent cache)
        nSecondLevelCapacity - The maximum number of entries this cache will store as soft references in the first level
        nThirdLevelCapacity - The maximum number of entries that will be stored as weak references after they have been removed from the first level

        public void clear()
        Clears both first and second level cache.

        public boolean contains(K rKey)
        Checks whether this cache contains a mapping with a certain key.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if this instance contains the given key

      • get

        public final V get(K rKey)
        Returns a certain value from this cache.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key to return the value for
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key or NULL if no such value exists or if it has expired

      • getCapacity

        public int[] getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the three levels of this cache.
        Returns:
        A three-element integer array containing the capacities of the cache levels

      • getUsage

        public java.lang.String getUsage()
        Returns a string that summarizes the current cache utilization.
        Returns:
        The utilization string

      • put

        public final void put(K rKey,
                      V rValue)
        Adds an entry to this cache. If the capacity of the first and/or second cache level is exceeded the oldest entry will be moved to the next cache level.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key to associate the value with
        rValue - The value of the entry

      • remove

        public final V remove(K rKey)
        Removes a certain value from this cache.
        Parameters:
        rKey - The key associated with the value to remove
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key or NULL for none

      • setCapacity

        public void setCapacity(int nFirstLevel,
                        int nSecondLevel,
                        int nThirdLevel)
        Sets the capacities of the different cache levels.
        Parameters:
        nFirstLevel - The maximum number of entries that will be kept permanently in this cache (zero to disable the permanent cache)
        nSecondLevel - The maximum number of entries this cache will store as soft references in the first level
        nThirdLevel - The maximum number of entries that will be stored as weak references after they have been removed from the first level
